At Orica, it’s the power of our people that leads change and shapes our futures. Every day, all around the world, our people help mobilise vital resources essential to progress. About The Role

This role will manage the engineering design and operational support requirements for OMS Asia region and technical cyanide support requirements for the Asia region. The role report to the Projects and Asset Management Manager Asia and is required to be located in Indonesia with travel across the Asia region as needed to support the operations.

The incumbent, as part of the Asia Projects & Engineering team, fulfils a critical business and technical support role in the OMS business, providing expert mechanical engineering design services, verification mechanical systems / equipment is fit for service and advice to the Region and general OMS group. The incumbent is further support cyanide business in Asia as the cyanide SME in particular for the delivery systems utilised on site. This includes mechanical governance and Responsible Engineering (RE) duties (Group Standards and relevant regulatory standards) in conjunction with advice and input on design development and equipment construction for manufacturing and delivery systems used by OMS in accordance with time and cost constraints.

 Safety execution & leadership
 Mechanical Engineering Support in capital projects and existing plant and assets
 Oversight and Management to meet relevant Regulatory and Statutory compliance of assets delivered by project team – (MPU, AEMSC, AS2187)
 Management of Design Resources
 Business improvement (delivering the savings, governance and process for mechanical related items)
 Regional engineering and CAPEX support
 Cost centre management support
 Cyanide SME support to Cyanide Business (in particular delivery systems).
 Ensure all designs produced comply with all relevant statutory and corporate standards.
 Ensuring that design requests are documented through the SAP Work Order system and supported by concept papers, scope of works and design reviews where appropriate.
 Maximise the utilisation of existing designs ensuring standardisation of components and design concepts for fixed plant and mobile equipment.
 Preparing or oversee mechanical design project estimates as appropriate.

 Evaluate protection systems to enable compliance with the Group's safety objectives.

 Implement and Manage Engineering pump standards, pump operating parameters, protection requirements, installation practices etc. for various pumping applications.

What You Will Bring

 Knowledge of statutory requirements relating to mechanical engineering (essential) and the commercial explosives industry (preference).
 Knowledge of engineering theory and practice covering all engineering disciplines including project management.

 The incumbent will be highly creative and innovative, and be solutions oriented.

 Experience in project management and managing small teams.
 Degree qualified in Mechanical Engineering.
 Registered RPEQ/Charted engineer

What We Offer

As part of a truly global company, you will have the ability to grow and learn in a diverse, collaborative culture. We foster relationships and learning through connected global and local teams, promote flexible and diverse career paths and support the development of your knowledge and skills.

You will be paid a competitive salary, learn from talented individuals across multiple disciplines and be able to thrive in a safe workplace within a collaborative culture. Ignite your career at a place where your distinct potential can find its home.
